contentrichtext.text: {{wiktionary|muck|mucky}} '''[[Muck (soil)|Muck]]''' is a soil made up primarily of humus from drained swampland '''Muck''' may also refer to: {{tocright}} ==Places== *[[Muck, Scotland]], an island *Isle of Muck, a small island connected by sand spit to Portmuck, [[County Antrim]], Northern Ireland *[[Muck Glacier]], Queen Maud Mountains, Antarctica ==People== *[[Desa Muck]] (born 1955), Slovene writer and actor *[[Karl Muck]] (1859–1940), German conductor *[[Warren Muck]] (1922–1945), non-commissioned officer in Easy Company, 101st Airborne Division, during World War II *[[Muck Sticky]] (born 1977), American musician, songwriter, actor and artist ==Games== *[[Muck (gambling)]], a number of actions, both legal and illegal **[[Muck (poker)]], the discard pile or the action of discarding one's hand *Multi-User Chat Kingdom or [[TinyMUCK]], a type of text-based multi-user game or chat forum ==Other uses== *[[Muck (mining)]], sorting out the rich ore from the poor rock in an underground metallic mine after blasting *A red bulldozer character in the children's television show ''[[Bob the Builder]]'' *[[Muck diving]], diving into a normally muddy or "mucky" environment ==See also== *[[Mucc]], a Japanese rock band *[[Muk (disambiguation)]] *[[Mucker (disambiguation)]] {{disambiguation|geo|surname}}
